title: Definition of Discrete
text: A discrete variable is a variable that can only take on a finite amount of values. For example, the sizes of pizzas at a certain restaurant would be a discrete variable, since they can only have lengths of 8", 12", and 16".

title: Definition of Continuous
text: A continuous variable is a variable that can take on an $$infinite$$ amount of values. For example, the temperature outside your front door is continuous since it can have almost any value. Whether its 23.5, 20.111..., or 25 degrees outside, the temperature can take on an $$infinite$$ amount of values since we can have an $$infinite$$ amount of decimal points.
